page.title: 12THE HEDGEROWS
page.content: In{Fenwick}nearly all the{hedgerows have been taken down so the wheat has a short stalk so it does not get damaged by the strong winds. In the other fields the wheat has a long stalk because the hedgerows have not been pulled out and they protect the wheat. Where there are hedgerows you find lots of wild flowers and animals like poppies, nettles and rabbits, foxes, moles and voles. The{winds}are strong and thats why we may need hedgerows. Farmers have hedgerows to help separate field from field. Where there are no hedges the fields are large so the{machinery}can work easily. The hedgerows that are left are old and well established. In some places the hedges have been{laid}in the old fashion way.
